member.name: T:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController
member.summary: Used to communicate with an Atrium Controller using Atrium SDK and HTTP.

member.name: P:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.MaxAttempts
member.summary: Maximum number of attempts to establish a session. (by default: 10. Maximum amount that can be set is 50.)

member.name: P:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.DelayBetweenAttempts
member.summary: The time in seconds to wait for the next attempt to log into the controller. (by default: 10 seconds)

member.name: P:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.RequestText
member.summary: Stores the Request XML data to the last POST request made.

member.name: P:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.ResponseText
member.summary: Stores the Response String from the last POST request made.

member.name: P:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.SerialNumber
member.summary: Serial number of the Atrium Controller that the AtriumConnection object is connected to.

member.name: P:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.ProductName
member.summary: Product name of the Atrium Controller that the AtriumConnection object is connected to.

member.name: P:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.ProductLabel
member.summary: Product label of the Atrium Controller that the AtriumConnection object is connected to.

member.name: P:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.ProductVersion
member.summary: Product version of the Atrium Controller that the AtriumConnection object is connected to.

member.name: P:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.GenerateGuid
member.summary: Generates a random Guid (128-bit ID) in the format of "########-####-####-####-############". This should never be the same string when called.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.ACCESS_LEVELS(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs an integer array of the 5 integer arguments. If an argument is not provided, then that Access Level is ignored.
member.param: Integer that represents the Object ID for an Access Level. By default: -1 for no access level
Integer that represents the Object ID for an Access Level. By default: -1 for no access level
Integer that represents the Object ID for an Access Level. By default: -1 for no access level
Integer that represents the Object ID for an Access Level. By default: -1 for no access level
Integer that represents the Object ID for an Access Level. By default: -1 for no access level

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.To26BitCardNumber(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts two 32-bit integers into one 26-bit integer. Specifically used for converting a Family Number and Member Number into it's 26-bit variant, where the Family Number is the upper 10 bits and the Member Number is the lower 16 bits.
member.param: 10-bit Int32 that corresponds to the Family Number on the card.
16-bit Int32 that corresponds to the Member Number that belongs to the related family.
member.returns: 26-bit integer directly converted from the family number bits concatenated with the member number bits. If family number or member number is less than 0, then -1 is returned.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an AtriumConnection object connected to the specified address under the specified username and password.
member.param: Username to log in as.
Password to log into Atrium under specified username
Atrium Controller Address to connect to

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.InsertUser(System.String,System.String,System.Guid,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Inserts a new User into the Atrium Controller with the provided information.
member.param: First name of the user to be inserted.
Last name of the user to be inserted.
User GUID that is to be attached to the user.
Activation date of the User.
Expiration date of the User.
Array of 5 integers between 0-9,999 (inclusive) that represent the Object ID for each Access Level.
member.returns: String object that is of real type int representing the Object ID as assigned by the Atrium Controller when user is inserted.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.InsertUser(ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.Objects.User)
member.summary: Inserts a User C# object into the Atrium Controller's database.
member.param: The User object to insert into the Atrium database.
member.returns: String object that is of real type int representing the Object ID as assigned by the Atrium Controller when user is inserted.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.GetAllUsers(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets all Users that exist in the Atrium database in increments. Best used when the number of Users in the database is unknown. Larger increments increases speed through HTTP but could be worse if the number of records that actually exist are on the short end of the increment. (e.g. 1034 records exist with a 1000 increment would force two HTTP requests searching for 2000 total records. An increment of 1035 or better would be best here) By default 100.
member.param: Increment of users to grab. Larger numbers increases speed through HTTP but could be worse if the number of records that actually exist are on the short end of the increment. (e.g. 1034 records exist with a 1000 increment would force two HTTP requests searching for 2000 total records. An increment of 1035 or better would be best here) By default 100.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.UpdateUser(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Updates a User, specified by the Atrium Controller's defined Object ID, to a new First Name, Last Name, Activation Date, and Expiration Date.
member.param: Object ID, as defined by the Atrium Controller, of what User to update.
New first name of the User to update.
New last name of the User to update.
New expiration date of the User to update.
New activation date of the User to update.
Array of 5 integers between 0-9,999 (inclusive) that represent the Object ID for each Access Level.
member.returns: Boolean indicating whether the user was successfully updated or not.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.InsertCard(System.String,System.Guid,System.Guid,System.String,System.Int32,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Inserts a new Card into Atrium under the provided information.
member.param: Display Name that the card should be under.
Card GUID that the card should be under.
User GUID that the card is attached to.
Atrium ObjectID that the Card should be attached to.
Number of the card that is to be used.
Activation Date of the card.
Expiration Date of the card.
member.returns: String object that is of real type int representing the Object ID as assigned by the Atrium Controller when card is inserted.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.InsertCard(ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.Objects.Card)
member.summary: Inserts a Card C# object into the Atrium Controller's database.
member.param: The Card object to be inserted into the Atrium Controller's database.
member.returns: String object that is of real type int representing the Object ID as assigned by the Atrium Controller when user is inserted.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.GetAllCards(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets all Users that exist in the Atrium database in increments. Best used when the number of Users in the database is unknown. Larger increments increases speed through HTTP but could be worse if the number of records that actually exist are on the short end of the increment. (e.g. 1034 records exist with a 1000 increment would force two HTTP requests searching for 2000 total records. An increment of 1035 or better would be best here) By default 100.
member.param: Increment of users to grab. Larger numbers increases speed through HTTP but could be worse if the number of records that actually exist are on the short end of the increment. (e.g. 1034 records exist with a 1000 increment would force two HTTP requests searching for 2000 total records. An increment of 1035 or better would be best here) By default 100.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.UpdateCard(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Updates a User, specified by the Atrium Controller's defined Object ID, to a new First Name, Last Name, Activation Date, and Expiration Date.
member.param: Object ID, as defined by the Atrium Controller, of what User to update.
The new name to replace current Display Name on the card.
New expiration date of the User to update.
New activation date of the User to update.
member.returns: Boolean indicating whether the card was successfully updated or not.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.CheckAnswer(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.Xml.Linq.XName,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks an element in an XML Response String that it has an "ok" answer.
member.param: XElement that is to be checked for the "ok"
Subelement name to check inside of xml
Optional: Attribute that the "ok" should be under. (by default: "err")
Optional: If true, throws an exception. Otherwise, returns a boolean indicating success or not. (by default: true)
member.returns: Boolean value indicating that "ok" is in the response string.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.CheckAllAnswers(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Xml.Linq.XElement},System.Xml.Linq.XName,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks a set of elements in an XML Response String that it has an "ok" answer.
member.param: Enumerable XML elements that are typically of "REC" type.
Subelement name to check inside of xml
Expected attribute that displays the response/answer message. (by default: "res")
Optional: If true, throws an exception. Otherwise, returns a boolean indicating success or not. (by default: true)
member.returns: Boolean value indicating that "ok" is in the response string.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.DoPOSTAsync(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a POST request to the specified Subdomain (under the Address provided from construction) with specific parameters to send.
member.param: The subdomain that the GET request is to be sent.
Dictionary of parameters that are to be sent with the POST request.
Optional: If true, sets a Cookie that stores the SessionID. (by default: false)
Optional: If true, expects the response to be encrypted and decrypts it upon reception. (by default: false)
member.returns: An asynchronous task that returns an XElement of the response. (XML Response)

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.DoGETAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Performs a GET request to the specified Subdomain (under the Address provided from construction)
member.param: The subdomain that the GET request is to be sent.
member.returns: An asynchronous task that returns an XElement of the response. (XML Response)

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.FetchXMLAsHttpContent(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Fetches an XML File and substitutes provided arguments and converts it to an HttpContent object.
member.param: File name of the XML template to be used.

Variable arguments of String objects that are used to substitute arguments in the XML template. The size of the amount of Strings to pass should be divisible by two where every even argument is what should be replaced by the odd argument.
member.returns: StringContent item that is to be used in the next POST request.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.FetchAndEncryptXML(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Fetches an XML File and substitutes provided arguments, encrypts it under the RC4 Encryption Algorithm, then creates an encrypted request to be sent.
member.param: XML template to use.

Variable arguments of String objects that are used to substitute arguments in the XML template. The size of the amount of Strings to pass should be divisible by two where every even argument is what should be replaced by the odd argument.
member.returns: A Dictionary of parameters that are to be used in a parameterized POST request.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.Rc4(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Performs RC4 encryption/decryption on a specified byte array with a specified byte array as the key.
member.param: Key that is used to encrypt/decrypt the data.
Data that is to be encrypted/decrypted
member.returns: Byte array that represents the ciphertext of data after encryption/decryption.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.Md5(System.String)
member.summary: Performs an MD5 Hash algorithm on a String.
member.param: String to perform the MD5 hash on.
member.returns: A byte array that is the result of hashing text.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.CheckSum(System.String)
member.summary: Counts the character codes of every character in given String to create a CheckSum.
member.param: String to be checksummed.
member.returns: A 16 bit Hexadecimal String that is built from the checksum of str.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.PadLeft(System.String,System.Char,System.Int32)
member.summary: Pads a string with a provided specific character to a provided total length.
member.param: String that is to be padded.
Character that is used when padding s.
Total length of what s should be.
member.returns: String s padded with c to the desired length.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.ByteArrayToHexString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts an array of bytes to a hexadecimal string.
member.param: Byte array to be converted to hexadecimal string
member.returns: A hexadecimal String as interpreted by the bytes.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.HexStringToByteArray(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a hexadecimal String to an array of bytes.
member.param: Hexadecimal string to convert into a byte array.
member.returns: Byte array that was converted from the hexadecimal string.

member.name: T:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.AnswerNotOkException
member.summary: Thrown when an Atrium Answer failed to interpret the XML request correctly.

member.name: P:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.AnswerNotOkException.Message
member.summary: Set when AnswerNotOkException is thrown and is determined by what the Response message is.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.AnswerNotOkException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Thrown when an Answer from a Response is not "ok".
member.param: Message to be shown in base Message.

member.name: T:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.HttpRequestException
member.summary: Thrown when an HTTP Request fails, usually when some encryption went wrong.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.HttpRequestException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Thrown when an HTTP Request is made using Encryption but the Response did not contain expected Encryption variables.

member.name: T:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.FailedToLoginException
member.summary: Thrown when the UserID returned from the second Atrium Controller Answer is -1.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.FailedToLoginException.#ctor
member.summary: Thrown when a login fails where it gets past all phases but the User ID returned is "-1".

member.name: T:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.AttributeDoesNotExistException
member.summary: Thrown when an Attribute does not exist inside of an XML Element.

member.name: P:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.AttributeDoesNotExistException.XmlString
member.summary: Returns the XML output that triggered the Exception.

member.name: M:ThreeRiversTech.Zuleger.Atrium.API.AtriumController.AttributeDoesNotExistException.#ctor(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String)
member.summary: Thrown when an Attribute does not exist inside of an XML request/response.
member.param: The XML documentation element that should contain the attribute.
The attribute that was searched for in the XML.
